IPL98 Bool, true and false for C only
[IPL98 Type enumerations and definitions (global)]

The type bool (integer) is only defined when IPL98 is used as an ANSI C only library. More...

Defines

#define false   0
 defines false to 0 (zero)

#define true   1
 defines true to 1 (one)


Typedefs

typedef int bool
 defines bool as an integer

Detailed Description

The type bool (integer) is only defined when IPL98 is used as an ANSI C only library.

The value "false" is defined as 0 and "true" as 1. In C++ the boolean type is already defined. Defined to comply with the C++ counterpart Tag

Updated 21. juli 2002 12:29 by René Dencker Eriksen(edr@mip.sdu.dk)
